revised_title: Investigating the Inverse Ratio between Respiration and Irritability in Animals and Hybernation
tldr: The author, Marshall Hall, explores the inverse relationship between respiration and irritability in animals and investigates the phenomenon of hybernation. He proposes a method to measure irritability and demonstrates that animals in hybernation have a higher degree of irritability compared to their active states. The study also highlights the differences between hybernation and torpor induced by excessive cold.
